The 'St. Lawrence and Atlantic Railroad' , known as 'St-Laurent et Atlantique
Quebec' in Canada, is a short line railroad operating between Portland, Maine on
the Atlantic Ocean and Montreal, Quebec on the St. Lawrence River. It crosses
the Canada-U.S. border at Norton, Vermont, and is owned by short line operator
Genesee and Wyoming.

The line was built by the Atlantic and St. Lawrence Railroad in the U.S. and the
St. Lawrence and Atlantic Railway in Canada, meeting at Island Pond, Vermont
south of the CanadaâUnited States border. Major communities served include
Portland and Lewiston in Maine; Berlin, New Hampshire; Island Pond, Vermont; and
Sherbrooke and Montreal in Quebec.
